page.title: 11Recreation Continued.
page.content: {Fishing on the Wye.} The River Wye meanders through three of our areas.The surrounding low land is fertile and planted with corn. This stretch of river is known as the Maesllwch Fishery.The Fishery Manager came to school to talk to us.He had just caught a 10lb salmon which would cost Â£40 in the shops.He showed us a variety of rods,spinners,hooks and weights for spin fishing.He also showed us a beautiful variety of flies for fly fishing. The types of fish found in the Wye are Chub,Dace,Roach,Barble,Bleak,Gudgeon, Grayling,Pike,Eel,Sea Trout(Sewin), Twait,Shad,Perch,Trout and Salmon. The scales of every salmon caught have to be sent to the Fishery Department, Hereford together with the weight,type of rod used and date caught.The Wye is noted for its Spring Salmon.
